quiz.text:
Recently (June 2023), the Union Minister of Education has released the UGC (Institutions Deemed to be Universities) Regulations, 2023. Which of the following eligibility criteria to apply for ‘deemed to be university’ status is/are correct?

1.      NAAC ‘A’ grade with at least a 3.01 CGPA for three consecutive cycles.

2.      NBA accreditation for two third of eligible programmes for three consecutive cycles.

3.      In the top 100 of any specific category of NIRF for the last three years continuously.

4.      In top 200 of overall NIRF Ranking for last three years continuously.
options: 2 and 3
1 and 2
1, 3 and 4
1, 2, 3 and 4
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), ________ has signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Directorate General of Training (DGT), Ministry of Skills Development and Entrepreneurship (MSDE), to train 6,000 students and 200 educators in digital and cyber-security skills in the country.
options: Google
Infosys
Meta
Microsoft
Tech Mahindra

quiz.text:
Recently (June 2023), Green Grids Initiative - One Sun, One World, One Grid has been in the news. Which of the following statements with regards to phases of OSOWOG is/are correctly mentioned?

1.      Phase 1 - Indian grid would be connected to the grids of Middle East, South Asia and South-East Asia to develop a common grid.

2.      Phase 2 – Connect the functional first phase to the pool of renewable resources in Europe.

3.      Phase 3 – Involves global interconnection.
options: 1 and 2
3 only
1 and 3
1 only
1, 2 and 3

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), the Ministry of Power has granted waiver of Inter-State Transmission System (ISTS) charges to ____________ commissioned on or before _________ for a period of _________ from the date of commissioning of the Project.
options: Off-shore wind power projects; 31st December, 2032; 25 years
On-shore wind power projects; 31st December 2030; 25 years
Green Hydrogen/Green Ammonia projects; 31st December 2032; 20 years
Off-shore wind power projects; 31st December, 2032; 20 years
Off-shore wind power projects; 31st December, 2030; 25 years

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (MoHUA) in collaboration with the _______________ has organized a City-Recycler Connect workshop.
options: World Bank (WB)
United States Agency for International Development (US AID)
United Nations Development Programme (UN DP)
German Development Cooperation (GIZ)
French Development Agency (AFD)

quiz.text:
Recently (June 2023), the Union Cabinet chaired by the Hon’ble Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi, has approved the CITIIS 2.0. Which of the following statements is/are correct with regards to CITIIS 2.0?

1.      CITIIS 2.0 stands for City Investments to Innovate, Integrate and Sustain 2.0.

2.      The program will run for a period of five years, from 2023 till 2028.

3.      CITIIS 2.0 has been launched in partnership with German Development Cooperation (GIZ).
options: 1 and 2
2 and 3
1 only
2 only
1, 2 and 3

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), _________ has been launched for Monitoring of Centrally Sponsored Scheme for Development of Infrastructure for Judiciary.
options: Nyaya Infra Portal
Nyaya Bhumika Portal
Nyaya Sang Rachna Portal
Nyaya Development Portal
Nyaya Vikas Portal

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), _____________ has formed three committees to frame draft schemes for pension, provident fund and insurance under the retirement fund body, in line with the provisions of the Social Security Code, 2020.
options: Reserve Bank of India
Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority
Securities and Exchange Board of India
Employees’ Provident Fund Organization
Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), Union Minister of Ports, Shipping & Waterways has called for greater cooperation among BBINM countries for maximizing maritime trade potential. Which of the following country is not a part of BBINM?
options: Bangladesh
Bhutan
Nepal
Myanmar
Maldives

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), _________ from India has joined the Centralized Laboratory Network for testing vaccines level.
options: ICMR - National Institute of Virology
ICMR - National Institute of Traditional Medicine
ICMR - National Centre for Diseases Informatics and Research
ICMR - National Institute for Research in Environmental Health
ICMR - National Institute for Research in Tuberculosis

quiz.text: Identify ‘X’ from the following options?
options: Iron
Copper
Lithium
Steel
Silver

quiz.text: Which of the following Indian state is the largest producer of ‘X’?
options: Haryana
Rajasthan
Madhya Pradesh
Jharkhand
Chhattisgarh

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), the eighth meeting of the Standing Committee of the International Solar Alliance (ISA) has been held in New Delhi. ISA was conceptualized during COP21 to UNFCCC in ______ at ________.
options: 2016; Paris, France
2016; Rome, Italy
2015; London, United Kingdom
2015; Paris, France
2014; London, United Kingdom

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), India has emerged as a key source country for Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in Dubai. Which of the following was the top sector by FDI projects (percentage) from India into Dubai in 2022?
options: Business services
Real Estate
Consumer Products
Financial Services
Software & IT services

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), Union Minister of Steel in a press conference has shared the data regarding the steel sector in India. As per the data shared, India currently ranks as the World's _______ Largest Producer of Crude Steel, surpassing ________in 2018
options: 3rd; China
4th; Japan
2nd; China
3rd; Japan
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are incorrect with regards to the National Mission titled “Mission on Advanced and High-Impact Research (MAHIR)”?
options: It will be funded by World Bank and National Investment and Infrastructure Fund.
It has been launched by Ministry of Power and Ministry of New and Renewable Energy.
Mission will run for initial period of five years from 2023-24 to 2027-28.
Mission will follow the technology life cycle approach of Idea to Product.
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), the Central Electricity Authority (CEA) has notified the National Electricity Plan (NEP) for the period of 2022-32. As per the NEP, share of non-fossil based capacity is likely to increase to ________ by the end of 2026-27.
options: 57.4%
61.4%
47.4%
71.4%
52.4%

quiz.text:
Under National Policy for Rare Diseases (NPRD), 2021, the rare diseases have been identified and categorized into 3 groups. Which of the following group(s) is/are correctly matched?

1.      Group 1:  Disorders amenable to one-time curative treatment.

2.      Group-2: Diseases for which definitive treatment is available but challenges are to make optimal patient selection for benefit, very high cost and lifelong therapy.

3.      Group 3: Diseases requiring long term/lifelong treatment having relatively lower cost of treatment and annual or more frequent surveillance is required.
options: 1 only
2 only
1 and 3
1, 2 and 3
None of the above

quiz.text: As per National Policy for Rare Diseases (NPRD), 2021, patients listed under Group 1 will have the financial support of up to _________ under the umbrella scheme of Rashtriya Arogya Nidhi.
options: Rs. 20 lakh
Rs. 10 lakh
Rs. 50 lakh
Rs. 25 lakh
Rs. 5 lakh

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has informed that the Infection Geography of ________ has increased from __________ States/ Union Territories (UTs) in 2001 to all states/ UTs now.
options: Malaria; Eight
Dengue; Eight
Dengue; Twelve
Malaria; Twelve
Dengue; Six
